I noticed the caravan seems to have begun the process of preparing for travel again. My observations are confirmed in the evening when the caravan merchant joins me for dinner and shares his thanks for my hospitality. \n  We enjoy a fine wine that brought with him, and as our meal winds down, he offers to share a tale that he's learned from his travels. I ponder my mood and the quality of his wine and then answer.
I'm always interested in new tales, please share.
No need for a story. May your travels be safe.

The caravan merchant is a very capable story teller. His flair is so impressive, that I didn't even realize that it's a story that I've heard before until it's almost a third of the way through. I smile with the realization, and settle back to enjoy his stirring rendition of a tale with suspense and eroticism. 
  When his tale ends, the dining room is filled with applause. Even though a few others caught onto the familiar tale, the merchant's rendition was an art unto itself. 
  Afterwards, the merchant thanks me for the hospitality and offers me the services of a futanari that was travelling with him. He assures me that he found their assistance valuable, and he believes their skills may be more worthwhile in my court than his caravan. 
  Considering his offer, I respond.
I thank you for the story and I accept your gift.
